item.title: Mining a Medieval court roll 4: Topic Modelling
item.description: This code firstly takes three columns word, lincsID and UUID from the dataframe lincsEvents and creates a new dataframe called lincsDTM. These are columns which contain the text from the Lincoln Records Society volume (word), the original reference provided by McLane (lincsID) and a unique identifier which I created when I annotated the text originally (UUID). The following code firstly deletes the first word in the column word.

item.title: Mining a Medieval Court Roll 3: TF-IDF
item.description: Term frequency inverse document frequency (TF-IDF) is both a mouthful and a process often carried out as part of the text mining approach. The primary idea behind TF-IDF is to find the words which are most important for the content of each document by decreasing the weight for commonly used words and increasing the weight for words that are not used very much in a collection as a whole.
